channel.title: Setting up your own proxy?
channel.description:
I want to make an online based proxy to use at school. I have an admin account at school, but I want to create a proxy for my friends to use because just about every single proxy I can find is blocked.
I lookedon google, but they say stuff like upload it to your server, make sure the server has CGI support, etc..
But I want to use my home computer. Does anyone have any clue where to start? There must be some free open source proxy that I can configure to use at my house. I have a decent internet speed, but I know it'll be slow as hell but I dont care.
What programs would I need? Or where should I start?
Would I need something like Apache?(I've never used it before, is it easy to use?) And does anyone know any program/scripts for creating an http proxy that is webbased?
Security is not an issue also, because it'll only be shared with a few friends. [br][size=1]Posted at: May 13, 2006, 09:43:30 am[/size][hr]Oh and will I need a domain name? or can i use no-ip.org?[br][size=1]Posted at: May 13, 2006, 09:45:23 am[/size][hr]Hmm.. I found a neat program:
http://www.peacefire.org/circumventor/simple-circumventor-instructions.html
I'll give it a try first. [br][size=1]Posted at: May 13, 2006, 09:51:29 am[/size][hr]Lol another question:
It says port 443 is blocked. I have enabled it in my router, and i did everything it said. I have turned off my firewall, and yet it still says it is blocked. Anyone know whats wrong?

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?

item.description:

[quote=“jme, post:9, topic:2772”][quote author=Niall link=topic=3052.msg2843340#msg2843340 date=1246115631]
Did you have to dig a 3 year topic up?
[/quote]

Yeah plus it reminds me how dumb I was in 2006. >.>

I cringed reading my own post.[/quote]

I know, I get the same feeling.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“elitepvper, post:6, topic:2772”]I have a question, (btw this is my first post) Sorry if im breaking any rules.

How do you password protect your site? and if you want to access blocked sites try downloading ultrasurf, it works anywhere and lets you do what you want. You can download it at www.ultrasurf.com, if that doesnt work just search it up on download.com (where i downloaded it)[/quote]

Did you have to dig a 3 year topic up?

Protip: Don’t browse the last page.

Read full topic

else use Glype on a webserver.

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @elitepvper elitepvper
item.description:
@elitepvper wrote:

I have a question, (btw this is my first post) Sorry if im breaking any rules.

How do you password protect your site? and if you want to access blocked sites try downloading ultrasurf, it works anywhere and lets you do what you want. You can download it at www.ultrasurf.com, if that doesnt work just search it up on download.com (where i downloaded it)

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I bought some webhosting, and have a proxy on the site now And it is all working now. To prevent my school finding out about it,I have password protected the site

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @AARisAIR AARisAIR
item.description:
@AARisAIR wrote:

Like I said I hosted CGI proxy, it worked fine on my PC but I hosted it myself, yes you need Peal installed and just config it in your PHP config file.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

AARisAIR:

Eh i'm not sure but maybe your ISP blocks 443 because they dont want people to access proxys? I used CGI proxy and just made a web proxy on my port 81 apache server, it worked great for me. Sorry I cant be of more help.

I contacted my ISP, they tell me to contact linksys(maker of my router) so i phoned them up, they tell me to phone my ISP.

Man this is so annoying, lol. I'll use the "Im paying you 50 dollars a month so give me an answer" on my isp -.-[br][size=1]Posted at: May 14, 2006, 08:54:20 am[/size][hr]Im done talking to them all, they are all retards.

I decided to look up google for more info, and found a few free hosts/servers that have CGI support and I tried them. I just finished setting it all up, bow I get an error message saying CGIproxy initializing failed!

According the this open source proxy, Perl 5.something has to be installed. Does anyone know a good host with all this? I dont want to have to resort to azn-hosting because he'll never do anything for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up your own proxy?
item.dc:creator: @AARisAIR AARisAIR
item.description:
@AARisAIR wrote:

Eh i'm not sure but maybe your ISP blocks 443 because they dont want people to access proxys? I used CGI proxy and just made a web proxy on my port 81 apache server, it worked great for me. Sorry I cant be of more help.

Read full topic
